March to the Top
May 23, 2018 at 3:17 PM ·

March to the Top’s Pen Pal Partnership with Harlem Village Academies is in full swing! 💌
-
Our students at New Hope - AINA were excited to receive letters and photos from students all the way in New York City!
We had an incredible time writing responses, drawing pictures, and taking photos to send back to their new friends at HVA.
During this exciting time, we listened to music from the United States and played with face-paints on behalf of a generous donor!
-
We are so grateful for this partnership which fosters cultural understanding and friendships across oceans!✏️🌍

Dear Friends,

Did you know that only 9% of children in low-income neighborhoods such as Harlem will graduate from college? That’s compared to 77% of students from more affluent parts of New York City, just a few blocks from our schools.
At HVA, we believe that a child’s opportunities in life should not be based on his or her zip code and that is why we work to ensure that 100% of our students go to college.

HVA students are beating the odds.

We provide an outstanding K-12 education for over 2,000 children each year because we know, as you do, that education is the most effective way to achieve equality and break the cycle of poverty.

Say yes to equality.
Say yes to education.
Say yes to HVA.

Please make your gift today.
Thank you from everyone at HVA!

post_text: This week the HVA High science faculty and students hosted their annual science fair, with well over a hundred of our friends, family and teachers participating! Students worked in small groups to develop goals, formulate hypotheses, conduct experiments and present their findings at the event. Topics included cell structure, neuron activity, tissue and organ systems, stress effects and many more. It was a truly memorable night of discovery and exploration and an overwhelming success. Congratulations to everyone involved in making this event possible!
